t: Psalm 88
A song. A psalm of the Sons of Korah. For the director of music. According to mahalath leannoth. A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.
Lord,*spn you are the God who saves me; day*ld and night I cry out to you.
May*ln my prayer come before you; turn*ld your ear to my cry.
I*pn am overwhelmed with troubles and*ld my life draws near to death.
I*ln am counted among those who go down to the pit; I*ld am like one without strength.
I*ln am set apart with the dead, like*ld the slain who lie in the grave, whom*ln you remember no more, who*ld are cut off from your care.
You*pn have put me in the lowest pit, in*ld the darkest depths.
Your*ln wrath lies heavily on me; you*ld have overwhelmed me with all your waves.
You*ln have taken from me my closest friends and*ld have made me repulsive to them. I*ln am confined and cannot escape;
my*ld eyes are dim with grief. I*pn call to you, Lord,*s every day; I*ld spread out my hands to you.
Do*ln you show your wonders to the dead? Do*ld their spirits rise up and praise you?
Is*ln your love declared in the grave, your*ld faithfulness in Destruction?
Are*ln your wonders known in the place of darkness, or*ld your righteous deeds in the land of oblivion?
But*pn I cry to you for help, Lord;*s in*ld the morning my prayer comes before you.
Why,*ln Lord,*s do you reject me and*ld hide your face from me?
From*pn my youth I have suffered and been close to death; I*ld have borne your terrors and am in despair.
Your*ln wrath has swept over me; your*ld terrors have destroyed me.
All*ln day long they surround me like a flood; they*ld have completely engulfed me.
You*ln have taken from me friend and neighborâ€” darkness*ld is my closest friend.
